sincere/authentic/really/truly
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

definition: to kill a pig as a lesson to the children (idiom); parents must teach by example
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
sincere belief and diligent study
if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
don't let rhetoric spoil the message (idiom); don't get carried away with flowery speech to the detriment of what you want to say
not to reject a word because of the speaker (idiom, from Analects); to judge on the merits of the case rather than preference between advisers
to call sth a cow or a horse (idiom); it doesn't matter what you call it/Insult me if you want, I don't care what you call me.
If one is industrious, one will not be in want. (idiom)
to bear one's own responsibilities and not pass them to others (idiom)
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost/same as 鞠躬盡瘁|鞠躬尽瘁[ju1 gong1 jin4 cui4]
Confucius says:
almost everything has a start, but not many things have an end (idiom); don't start sth you can't handle

definition: lit. the dog that bites does not show its fangs (idiom)/fig. You can't tell the really dangerous enemy from his external appearance.
